children.text: This is where you can create entries. This text editor should work like any other word processor you use, with some altered functionality. This is done to keep entry formats semi-consistent as it's beneficial for readability and comprehension for all users. Additionally, every entry is given a contents page by default, which is generated from any headings you add to the document. Furthermore, anytime you
make something a primary heading (heading 1), it will break off into a new page in the public entry.
There are quite few different tools in this editor you can use to help make entries.
There are a number of useful keybinds that you can use to make writing a bit quicker, here is the list...

Not all entries have to be public for everyone to see. When submitting an entry, you can choose to keep it private so it's just for your viewing. You can undo this at any time, so if you want to make an entry private or public again, you may do so.

These are just keywords for your entry to give users, including yourself, an idea of what to expect in the entry. When submitting an entry you'll be asked to add some tags but you do not have to add any. However, it is recommended.

Realistically, you should write something to do with the units you are engaging with. This means you could write lecture notes, revision notes, or potentially some coursework although I would recommend using a word processor for that type of work. Entries are meant to be more akin to a wikipedia article than an actual document for submission. In other words, the styling may be inadequate.
Additionally, please do not submit entries which are unrelated to a unit. These will be removed if made public, and you will temporarily be unable to contribute to any unit. Otherwise, go wild.
